intro: Gomphrena glabrata var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of pink to red bracts that resemble small flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, long-lasting inflorescences that are often used in dried flower arrangements. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. The botanical features of this plant make it both ornamental and drought-tolerant.
